abstract: <jats:p><jats:italic>Incurvariapirinella</jats:italic>Junnilainen, Kaitila &amp; Mutanen,<jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>is described from Bulgaria based on specimens collected by netting and artificial light from several low-elevation localities in Bulgaria. The species is morphologically and genetically most similar to<jats:italic>I.triglavensis</jats:italic>Hauder, 1912. Differences between these two species are present in external appearance and genitalia of both sexes. Additionally,<jats:italic>I.pirinella</jats:italic>shows a distance of 4.74% to its nearest neighbour<jats:italic>I.triglavensis</jats:italic>in the standard DNA barcoding marker (COI-5P). We provide preliminary observations of phylogenetic affinities of European<jats:italic>Incurvaria</jats:italic>and briefly discuss habitat preferences of some species. All species have distinct barcodes with minimum K2P divergences between species averaging 7.05% (range 1.2–12.8%). A world checklist of<jats:italic>Incurvaria</jats:italic>Haworth, 1828 is provided and DNA barcodes for all European species are here released. Finally, we document morphological variation in male genitalia within<jats:italic>I.triglavensis</jats:italic>Hauder, 1912.</jats:p>
title: Incurvaria pirinella sp. nov., a new species of the vetulella species-group (Lepidoptera, Incurvariidae) from Bulgaria, with release of DNA barcodes for European species of Incurvaria

reference.article-title: Ordnung Lepidoptera. 1. Teil. Pyralidina, Tortricina, Tineina, Eriocraniina und Micropterygina.
